item.title: New York in One Day Guided Sightseeing Tour
item.description: Make the most of your time in the city that never sleeps on a guided tour of NYC’s top attractions. Travel by both the Staten Island Ferry and bus as you swing by the 9/11 Memorial, Central Park, Rockefeller Center and more. Then hop aboard a one-trip Ferry ride for a sightseeing cruise past the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, complete with stunning views of the world-famous skyline and Brooklyn Bridge.

image.alt: New York in One Day Guided Sightseeing Tour

item.title: Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island Tour: All Options
item.description: One of the US’ most iconic symbols, the Statue of Liberty rises up from New York Harbor, welcoming the immigrants who once entered through nearby Ellis Island. Visit Lady Liberty and learn the stories of those who passed through Ellis Island on this convenient tour with options that let you choose how long you want to spend at each attraction. Opt to visit the Ellis Island National Museum of Immigration.

image.alt: Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island Tour: All Options

item.title: 9/11 Memorial Museum Admission Ticket
item.description: Prebook your admission to the 9/11 Memorial Museum in lower Manhattan, and guarantee your entry to the center that documented the terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center in 2001. Museum artifacts include first-person accounts of what happened on that September morning in 2001, multi-media displays, and exhibits on history, which commemorate nearly 3,000 people who lost their lives in the attacks.

image.alt: 9/11 Memorial Museum Admission Ticket

item.title: Private Central Park Pedicab Tour
item.description: One of New York City’s most celebrated sights, Central Park is a vast green space plum in the heart of Manhattan. With this private pedicab tour, see more of this leafy oasis than possible on foot in the same time, and hear stories of highlights such as Bethesda Fountain and the Strawberry Fields John Lennon memorial from a guide—insight you might miss if you were going it alone.

image.alt: Private Central Park Pedicab Tour

item.title: Central Park Pedicab Guided Tours
item.description: Hop aboard a pedicab—a bicycle-powered cab—for a private ride around New York City's Central Park. Enjoy the undivided attention of your guide and the chance to customize your itinerary to include four stops of your choosing among more than 20 local attractions. Riding in a pedicab will get you around the 843-acre (341-hectare) park much more efficiently than you ever could on foot.

image.alt: Central Park Pedicab Guided Tours

item.title: 9/11 Memorial, Ground Zero Tour with Optional 9/11 Museum Ticket
item.description: In remembrance of the tragic events that took place on September 11, 2001, take this walking tour of Ground Zero and the National 9/11 Memorial. Walk through the space of the former World Trade Center in New York City. A certified guide with a personal connection to the events of that day shares stories of tragedy and heroism. Get a deeper understanding of the events that took place here. Upgrade to add entry into the National 9/11 Museum.

image.alt: 9/11 Memorial, Ground Zero Tour with Optional 9/11 Museum Ticket

item.title: SUMMIT One Vanderbilt Experience Ticket
item.description: See the New York City skyline in a way you’ll never forget. The SUMMIT One Vanderbilt is an observation deck like no other, with three floors of mind-bending immersive art, a bar, and, of course, incredible views over the city. It’s an experience perfect for a day out with the family or a romantic date with your significant other, and it's great for locals and tourists alike.

image.alt: SUMMIT One Vanderbilt Experience Ticket

item.title: All-Access 9/11: Ground Zero Tour, Memorial and Museum, One World Observatory
item.description: Learn more about the events of September 11, 2001, on this guided tour of Ground Zero, the 9/11 Memorial and Museum, and the One World Observatory. Get a deeper understanding of the events of that day from your local guide, who will share first-hand stories. Get skip-the-line access to the 9/11 Museum and Memorial, and admire panoramic New York City views from the observatory.

image.alt: All-Access 9/11: Ground Zero Tour, Memorial and Museum, One World Observatory

item.title: New York Catacombs by Candlelight
item.description: Go behind-the-scenes and deep underground at the Basilica of St. Patrick’s Old Cathedral, with the only Catholic catacombs in New York City. See parts of the church that are otherwise off-limits to visitors. As you explore with the help of a guide, learn all about the landmark’s place in New York history and discover the final resting place of some famous New Yorkers.

image.alt: New York Catacombs by Candlelight

item.title: SoHo, Little Italy, and Chinatown Walking Tour in New York
item.description: Visit some of Lower Manhattan’s most hip and interesting neighborhoods—SoHo, Little Italy, and Chinatown—into one short walking tour. In SoHo, visit the Cast Iron Historic District and learn about 19th-century architecture. In Little Italy, see mob sites and hear about the city’s mafia history. In Chinatown, soak up the sights, smells, and sounds of the neighborhood. Get a close-up experience of the neighborhoods by exploring on foot.

image.alt: SoHo, Little Italy, and Chinatown Walking Tour in New York

item.title: Official NYC Horse Carriage Rides in Central Park since 1979 ™
item.description: Ramp up the romance and magic on your trip to NYC, and see more in less time, with a private horse and carriage ride around Central Park. Choose from different tour durations to fit your budget and schedule. See key park sights, such as Wollman Rink, the Central Park Carousel, Strawberry Fields, and more. You can also feed the horse a treat and stay cozy with warm blankets in winter.

image.alt: Official NYC Horse Carriage Rides in Central Park since 1979 ™

item.title: New York City Statue of Liberty Super Express Cruise
item.description: Don't waste precious time in New York City at the Statue of Liberty when you can view the iconic landmark on this speedy Lady Liberty cruise, perfect for travelers with limited time. Soak up the sea breeze and views as you're whisked past Lady Liberty. You can marvel at the statue from the water, learn about the landmark from your guide's live narration, and snap a few up-close photos with unobstructed views.

image.alt: New York City Statue of Liberty Super Express Cruise

item.title: Boroughs of NYC: Harlem, Bronx, Queens, Brooklyn & Coney Island
item.description: Get out of tourist-heavy Manhattan on a day trip through New York City’s other neighborhoods and boroughs, including Harlem, the Bronx, Queens, and Brooklyn. Coney Island is optional. Avoid catching slow, confusing public transit and enjoy the views as your guide navigates the way through places travelers often miss. Going with a guide also ensures you spot hidden landmarks and leave with an insider’s understanding of New York’s outer boroughs.

image.alt: Boroughs of NYC: Harlem, Bronx, Queens, Brooklyn & Coney Island

item.title: NYC Bus Tour of Brooklyn, Bronx, Queens: Contrasts, Color and Character
item.description: Explore four of New York City’s boroughs with this all-day guided bus tour. Ride around comfortably and learn about Harlem’s African-American history at the Apollo Theater, see the graffiti murals and colorful street art in the Bronx and Brooklyn, immerse yourself in downtown Flushing’s Chinatown, and experience the culture and traditions of Brooklyn’s Hasidic Jewish community.

image.alt: NYC Bus Tour of Brooklyn, Bronx, Queens: Contrasts, Color and Character

item.title: Original NYC Guided Food Tour of Chinatown and Little Italy
item.description: Tuck into the flavors and traditions of two of New York's top foodie neighborhoods on this Chinatown and Little Italy food tour. While exploring these neighborhoods can be overwhelming on your own, traveling with a guide enables you to focus on the food rather than worrying about getting lost. Plus, the guide takes you to off-the-beaten-path establishments where you can sample gourmet food samples at local eateries.

image.alt: Original NYC Guided Food Tour of Chinatown and Little Italy

item.title: NYC City Tour: Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Memorial, Wall Street
item.description: Discover four of New York City's most memorable sites on this exclusive tour, available nowhere else. Hear the history of Wall Street on a guided walking tour, then visit the 9/11 Memorial to learn about one of the most significant events in NYC history. Next, ride the ferry to Liberty Island and enjoy an audio tour of the Statue of Liberty and its museum, before continuing to Ellis Island and its museum.

image.alt: NYC City Tour: Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Memorial, Wall Street

item.title: New York Night Tour: Open Top Bus Tour by TopView®
item.description: Watch New York City come to life after dark on an evening coach tour by double-decker bus, and follow an exciting route through the heart of Manhattan’s highlights. Enjoy views of the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges as well as the iconic Manhattan skyline illuminated at night. Choose the "live guide" option for commentary from an onboard host or the audio tour to hear facts about the "City That Never Sleeps" in several languages.

image.alt: New York Night Tour: Open Top Bus Tour by TopView®

item.title: Washington DC and Philadelphia in One Day from NYC
item.description: Experience two of the US's capital cities—the current one in Washington DC and the former one in Philadelphia—on a full-day trip from New York City. Perfect for busy travelers with just one day to spare, this tour covers all the logistics and transportation so you don’t have to self-drive or arrange public transport tickets and connections. Check out the Lincoln Memorial, the White House, the Liberty Bell, and more.

image.alt: Washington DC and Philadelphia in One Day from NYC

item.title: Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island Guided Tour with Ferry
item.description: Get up close and personal with several New York City icons on this hassle-free tour. Meet your guide in Battery Park, and receive priority access to the Statue of Liberty ferry. You'll sail across the New York Harbor to Liberty Island, where you'll learn explore the Statue of Liberty Museum. Next, hop on another ferry to Ellis Island to discover the stories of the millions of immigrants who journeyed through this historic site.

image.alt: Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island Guided Tour with Ferry

item.title: New York Small-Group Tour plus One World Observatory Ticket
item.description: Don’t peer at New York City through a fogged bus window—take in the highlights of the Big Apple like a local on this one-of-a-kind full-day tour. You’ll move through the city on foot and by subway and ferry. Discover engineering secrets in Grand Central Terminal, reflect on 9/11 at Ground Zero, and see the bright lights of Broadway, with a private guide to answer questions along the way

image.alt: New York Small-Group Tour plus One World Observatory Ticket

item.title: Secret Food Tours NYC - Greenwich Village
item.description: New York City has been known for its yummy food for centuries, but if you don’t know the city well, you might pass up some of the city’s most delicious dishes. Choose from a Greenwich Village or Chinatown and Little Italy food tour and sample a range of foods from bagels and donuts to handmade dumplings and fresh mozzarella (depending on which tour you've selected).

image.alt: Secret Food Tours NYC - Greenwich Village

item.title: Greenwich Village Walking and Food Tasting Tour
item.description: Absorb New York City’s food culture on a walking tour of Greenwich Village. Skip hours of research and trust your guide as you head to the area’s top-rated eateries to sample a variety of New York specialities, from pizza to artisanal cupcakes. Along the way, your guide points out hidden landmarks often missed by visitors and locals alike, leaving you with inside knowledge about the neighborhood.

image.alt: Greenwich Village Walking and Food Tasting Tour

item.title: Secret Food Tour of Chinatown and Little Italy
item.description:
On our Secret Food Tour: Chinatown and Little Italy, you'll experience New York City’s most “Iconic" neighborhoods.
Get ready to experience the rich history, traditions, and flavors of New York City's most internationally recognized ethnic neighborhoods. Our 5-star cultural and gastronomic adventure promises to be an experience that will leave you with a newfound appreciation for the city and its diverse communities.
You will be eating all the way from Five Points to Chinatown, and from Little Italy to Nolita! As you journey through the streets with us, our knowledgeable guides will captivate you with fascinating stories about these vibrant places.
New York City is full of hidden gems, with this highly curated tour in Lower Manhattan, you'll have the chance to uncover some of the city's best-kept secrets, long known only to the locals!

image.alt: Secret Food Tour of Chinatown and Little Italy

item.title: Secrets of Grand Central Station Walking Tour New York City
item.description: Millions of travelers pass through Grand Central Terminal, but most never discover the secrets of this Manhattan showpiece. This tour lifts the lid: spotlighting the origins and evolution of the beaux arts train station from its heyday to disrepair and restoration. Spot detail and design quirks; and hear stories of its past that will give you a deeper understanding of the building than you could get alone.

image.alt: Secrets of Grand Central Station Walking Tour New York City
